snippet: The findings do not explain why women’s mental capacities tend to decline faster, but could alter the way drug trials are conducted, experts said.
abstract: Study presented at Alzheimer's Assn International Conference finds that women whose memory and mental acuity suffer from mild impairment later in life tend to decline toward dementia faster than men; findings do not indicate any causes for differences in genders.
lead_paragraph: The findings do not explain why women’s mental capacities tend to decline faster, but could alter the way drug trials are conducted, experts said.

headline.main: Dementia Develops Faster in Women Than in Men, Study Suggests
headline.print_headline: After First Signs, Dementia Develops Faster in Women Than in Men, Study Suggests
